meanings.definition: The act of dispersing or spreading something out
meanings.sent1: The dispersal of seeds helps plants grow in different places.
meanings.sent2: The dispersal of information through the internet is fast and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The dispersal of confetti at the party made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The dispersal of students after the bell rings is like a flock of birds scattering in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The dispersal of dust particles in the air can be seen under a beam of sunlight.

meanings.definition: The process of scattering or distributing something widely
meanings.sent1: The dispersal of clouds allowed the sun to shine through.
meanings.sent2: The dispersal of resources among the community ensures everyone has what they need.
meanings.sent3: The dispersal of toppings on the pizza was done with great care.
meanings.sent4: The dispersal of stars in the night sky creates a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The dispersal of colors in the painting added depth and vibrancy to the artwork.
